grading.policies: Assignments received 1-6 days late will have 20% of the total points deducted; assignments received more than one week late will receive 0 points.

policies.attendance: Attendance is not mandatory and will not be counted in the final grade.
policies.late_work: Assignments received 1-6 days late will have 20% of the total points deducted; assignments received more than one week late will receive 0 points.
policies.academic_integrity: Any plagiarism or other form of cheating will be dealt with under relevant Stevens policies.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

_metadata.course_description: This course aims at helping students from Financial Engineering and Financial Analytics with core courses study.
learning_outcomes: Use the basic syntax in R: if-else statement, loops, self-defined functions, etc.
Generate plots for analyzing data (e.g. scatter plot, bar plot, box plot).
Use data downloading packages to download stock and option data, read and write the date into .csv file.
Construct linear model for prediction and use stepwise regression for model selection.
Apply root finding methods (to calculate yield of bonds or implied volatility of options).
Generate random number for simulation (e.g. Monte-Carlo simulation for Black Scholes Model).
Solve optimization problems with R packages (e.g. Quadratic programming for Portfolio optimization).
Numerical integration (e.g. Calculate option price with numerical integration).
